pkgmetadata.longdescription: Psychometric Functions from the Waller Lab // Computes fungible coefficients and Monte Carlo data. Underlying theory for these functions is described in the following publications: Waller, N. (2008). Fungible Weights in Multiple Regression. Psychometrika, 73(4), 691-703, DOI:10.1007/s11336-008-9066-z. Waller, N. Jones, J. (2009). Locating the Extrema of Fungible Regression Weights. Psychometrika, 74(4), 589-602, DOI:10.1007/s11336-008-9087-7. Waller, N. G. (2016). Fungible Correlation Matrices: A Method for Generating Nonsingular, Singular, and Improper Correlation Matrices for Monte Carlo Research. Multivariate Behavioral Research, 51(4), 554-568. Jones, J. A. Waller, N. G. (2015). The normal-theory and asymptotic distribution-free (ADF) covariance matrix of standardized regression coefficients: theoretical extensions and finite sample behavior. Psychometrika, 80, 365-378, DOI:10.1007/s11336-013-9380-y. Waller, N. G. (2018). Direct Schmid-Leiman transformations and rank-deficient loadings matrices. Psychometrika, 83, 858-870. DOI:10.1007/s11336-017-9599-0.
